stateCompliance.headline: California Payday Loan Laws for Moreno Valley Residents
stateCompliance.content: Moreno Valley residents in Riverside County are protected by California's comprehensive Deferred Deposit Transaction Law, regulated by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). These regulations ensure strong consumer protections and ethical lending practices.
keyPoints: Maximum loan: $300 including all fees (typical $255 cash with $45 fee)
Maximum fee: 15% of check amount, maximum $45
One loan limit: Can only have one payday loan at a time
No rollovers: Cannot extend loans with additional fees
No criminal prosecution: Cannot threaten or pursue criminal action
NSF limited: Only one $15 fee per bounced check
Full transparency: All fees disclosed in dollars and APR
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes and does not constitute legal advice. Payday loan laws may change. For current information, contact the DFPI at 1-866-275-2677 or dfpi.ca.gov. For legal questions, consult a California attorney. Individual lender terms vary within state law limits.

faq.question: Where is your Moreno Valley location?
faq.answer: We're at 14567 Perris Boulevard, Suite 200, near Sycamore Creek Park and the College. Take I-215 Exit 32 toward Perris Boulevard. Excellent parking available.

faq.question: What documents do I need?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government ID, recent pay stub or bank statements, and your active checking account information. Most Moreno Valley residents are approved in 30 minutes.

faq.question: What's the maximum loan amount?
faq.answer: California law limits loans to $300 total including fees. You'll typically receive $255 cash with a $45 fee under the 15% fee cap.

faq.question: How long does approval take?
faq.answer: Most applicants at our Perris Boulevard location are approved and receive cash within 30 minutes. We have a quick verification process.

faq.question: Are there any hidden fees?
faq.answer: No hidden fees. California requires all fees to be disclosed clearly in dollars and APR before you sign.
